geofabric 0.1.0
  • Reference

Download osm data from geofabric

get_geofabric.Rd

Download osm data from geofabric

get_geofabric(name = "west-yorkshire", layer = "lines",
  attributes = make_additional_attributes(layer = layer),
  download_directory = tempdir(), ask = TRUE, max_dist = 3)

Arguments

name

Name of the geofabric zone to download
layer

Character string telling `sf` which OSM layer to import. One of `points`, `lines` (the default), `multilinestrings`, `multipolygons` or `other_relations`
attributes

Vector of character strings naming attributes to import
download_directory

Where to download the data? `tempdir()` by default.
ask

Should the user be asked before downloading the file?
max_dist

What is the maximum distance in fuzzy matching to tolerate before asking the user to select which zone to download?

Examples

get_geofabric("isle of man")
#> No exact matching geofabric zone. Best match is Isle of Man (2.2 MB)
#> Downloading http://download.geofabrik.de/europe/isle-of-man-latest.osm.pbf to 
#> /tmp/RtmpKQv95T/isle of man.osm.pbf
#> Old attributes: attributes=name,highway,waterway,aerialway,barrier,man_made
#> New attributes: attributes=name,highway,waterway,aerialway,barrier,man_made,maxspeed,oneway,building,surface,landuse,natural,start_date,wall,service,lanes,layer,tracktype,bridge,foot,bicycle,lit,railway,footway
#> Using ini file that can can be edited with file.edit(/tmp/RtmpKQv95T/ini_new.ini)
# \donttest{
get_geofabric("andorra")
#> No exact matching geofabric zone. Best match is Andorra (1.5 MB)
#> Downloading http://download.geofabrik.de/europe/andorra-latest.osm.pbf to 
#> /tmp/RtmpKQv95T/andorra.osm.pbf
#> Old attributes: attributes=name,highway,waterway,aerialway,barrier,man_made
#> New attributes: attributes=name,highway,waterway,aerialway,barrier,man_made,maxspeed,oneway,building,surface,landuse,natural,start_date,wall,service,lanes,layer,tracktype,bridge,foot,bicycle,lit,railway,footway
#> Using ini file that can can be edited with file.edit(/tmp/RtmpKQv95T/ini_new.ini)
get_geofabric("west-yorkshire")
#> No exact matching geofabric zone. Best match is West Yorkshire (28.7 MB)
#> Downloading http://download.geofabrik.de/europe/great-britain/england/west-yorkshire-latest.osm.pbf to 
#> /tmp/RtmpKQv95T/west-yorkshire.osm.pbf
#> Old attributes: attributes=name,highway,waterway,aerialway,barrier,man_made
#> New attributes: attributes=name,highway,waterway,aerialway,barrier,man_made,maxspeed,oneway,building,surface,landuse,natural,start_date,wall,service,lanes,layer,tracktype,bridge,foot,bicycle,lit,railway,footway
#> Using ini file that can can be edited with file.edit(/tmp/RtmpKQv95T/ini_new.ini)
# user asked to choose closest match when interactive
get_geofabric("kdljfdl")
#> No exact matching geofabric zone. Best match is Poland (1.1 GB)
#> Downloading http://download.geofabrik.de/europe/poland-latest.osm.pbf to 
#> /tmp/RtmpKQv95T/kdljfdl.osm.pbf
#> Old attributes: attributes=name,highway,waterway,aerialway,barrier,man_made
#> New attributes: attributes=name,highway,waterway,aerialway,barrier,man_made,maxspeed,oneway,building,surface,landuse,natural,start_date,wall,service,lanes,layer,tracktype,bridge,foot,bicycle,lit,railway,footway
#> Using ini file that can can be edited with file.edit(/tmp/RtmpKQv95T/ini_new.ini)
#> Warning: GDAL Error 1: Too many features have accumulated in points layer. Use OGR_INTERLEAVED_READING=YES mode
# get zone associated with a point
name = sf::st_sfc(sf::st_point(c(0, 53)), crs = 4326)
get_geofabric(name)
#> although coordinates are longitude/latitude, st_within assumes that they are planar
#> although coordinates are longitude/latitude, st_contains assumes that they are planar
#> The place is within these geofabrik zones: Europe, Great Britain, Britain and Ireland, England, Lincolnshire
#> Selecting the smallest: Lincolnshire
#> Downloading http://download.geofabrik.de/europe/great-britain/england/lincolnshire-latest.osm.pbf to 
#> /tmp/RtmpKQv95T/c(0, 53).osm.pbf
#> Old attributes: attributes=name,highway,waterway,aerialway,barrier,man_made
#> New attributes: attributes=name,highway,waterway,aerialway,barrier,man_made,maxspeed,oneway,building,surface,landuse,natural,start_date,wall,service,lanes,layer,tracktype,bridge,foot,bicycle,lit,railway,footway
#> Using ini file that can can be edited with file.edit(/tmp/RtmpKQv95T/ini_new.ini)
# }
